qas.question: A series of Prussian and German victories took place in what part of France?
What seige did these victories lead to?
What battle was a result of the Prussian and German victories in eastern France?
Which army definitively defeated Napolean III?

answers.text: the army of the Second Empire

qas.question: On what date did the Government of National Defence declare the the Third Republic in Paris?

context: A series of swift Prussian and German victories in <a0_0>eastern France<a0_0/>, culminating in the <a1_0>Siege of Metz<a1_0/> and the <a2_0>Battle of Sedan<a2_0/>, saw <a3_0>the army of the Second Empire<a3_0/> decisively defeated (Napoleon III had been captured at Sedan on 2 September). A Government of National Defence declared the Third Republic in Paris on <a4_0>4 September<a4_0/> and continued the war and for another five months, the German forces fought and defeated new French armies in northern France. Following the Siege of Paris, the capital fell on 28 January 1871 and then a revolutionary uprising called the Paris Commune seized power in the capital and held it for two months, until it was bloodily suppressed by the regular French army at the end of May 1871.
